intro: Auriculardisia rufa, commonly known as the red auriculate daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like inflorescences. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) base. Its flowers are typically pink to red in color, with yellow central disks, and bloom during the warmer months. Auriculardisia rufa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to well-drained, sandy soils.
